DzViewTool Class Reference
[Interface Components]

Base class for all tools that function in the 3D viewports. More...

#include <dzviewtool.h>

Detailed Description

Base class for all tools that function in the 3D viewports.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Default Constructor.

Parameters:
name The name of the view tool.

Destructor.

Member Function Documentation

void DzViewTool::activate (  )  [virtual]

Called by the framework when this becomes the active tool.

Reimplemented in DzMaterialPickTool, and DzPickTool.

DzViewTool::activated (  )  [signal]

Emitted when the viewtool becomes the active tool in the viewport.

void DzViewTool::added ( DzViewportMgr *  mgr  )  [inline, virtual]

Called when tool is added into viewportMgr Derived classes can overide this method if they need do something specific here.

void DzViewTool::aimCamera ( Dz3DViewport *  view  )  [virtual]

Called by the framework when the camera in the viewport is aimed

Reimplemented in DzMaterialPickTool.

void DzViewTool::contextMenu ( Dz3DViewport *  view,
DzMenu *  menu,
const QPoint &  pos 
) [inline, virtual]

Called when the given viewport is generating a context menu. View tools can add their own custom items to the menu. The pos given is the position of the mouse cursor in the view's local coordinates.

Reimplemented in DzMaterialPickTool, and DzPickTool.

void DzViewTool::deactivate (  )  [virtual]

Called by the framework when this tool becomes inactive.

Reimplemented in DzMaterialPickTool, and DzPickTool.

DzViewTool::deactivated (  )  [signal]

Emitted when the viewtool stops being the active tool in the viewport.

void DzViewTool::draw ( const DzDrawStyle &  style,
Dz3DViewport *  view 
) const [pure virtual]

Called by the framework to draw the tool in the given view. Do not attempt to do any drawing outside of this call, and do not call this function yourself - it should only be called by the framework - otherwise the results are undefined.

Parameters:
style The style to be used when drawing in the 3D view.
view The 3D viewport to draw in.

Implemented in DzMaterialPickTool, DzPickTool, DzRotateTool, DzScaleTool, and DzTranslateTool.

DzViewTool::drawnDataChanged (  )  [signal]

Emitted when the viewtool needs to be redrawn in the viewport.

void DzViewTool::frameCamera ( Dz3DViewport *  view  )  [virtual]

Called by the framework when the camera in the viewport is framed

Reimplemented in DzMaterialPickTool.

DzActionMenu * DzViewTool::getOptionsMenu (  )  const [slot]

Derived classes can return a popup menu that will be displayed when the user selects the options dropdown from the Tool pane.

QWidget * DzViewTool::getPane ( QWidget *  parent  )  const [inline, virtual]

Derived classes can return a panel that contains numeric controls, etc for manipulating the tool outside of the viewport, which will be displayed in the Tool pane.

Reimplemented in DzMaterialPickTool, and DzPickTool.

void DzViewTool::keyPress ( Dz3DViewport *  view,
QKeyEvent *  e 
) [inline, virtual]

Called when the user presses the key.

void DzViewTool::keyRelease ( Dz3DViewport *  view,
QKeyEvent *  e 
) [inline, virtual]

Called when the user releases the key.

bool DzViewTool::mouseDoubleClick ( Dz3DViewport *  view,
QMouseEvent *  e,
DzViewportMgr::ViewMouseModifier  accel 
) [inline, virtual]

Called by the viewport when the user double clicks on the viewport. This will be called after activate() and should modify the behavior of the tool if it is sensitive to double clicks. If this function returns true, the tool is accepting the mouse event, and will continue to receive drag events. If this function returns false, the viewport will handle the mouse event.

Reimplemented in DzPickTool.

void DzViewTool::mouseLeave ( Dz3DViewport *  view,
QEvent *  e 
) [inline, virtual]

Called by the framework when the mouse leaves the viewport.

Reimplemented in DzMaterialPickTool, and DzPickTool.

void DzViewTool::mouseMove ( Dz3DViewport *  view,
QMouseEvent *  e,
DzViewportMgr::ViewMouseModifier  accel 
) [inline, virtual]

Called when the user drags the mouse (with button down) in the viewport. The x and y values are the location of the mouse relative to the upper left corner of the viewport.

Reimplemented in DzTransformTool.

void DzViewTool::mouseOver ( Dz3DViewport *  view,
QMouseEvent *  e,
DzViewportMgr::ViewMouseModifier  accel 
) [inline, virtual]

Called by the framework when the mouse moves to a new location.

Reimplemented in DzMaterialPickTool, DzPickTool, and DzTransformTool.

bool DzViewTool::mousePress ( Dz3DViewport *  view,
QMouseEvent *  e,
DzViewportMgr::ViewMouseModifier  accel 
) [inline, virtual]

Called by the framework when the user clicks on the viewport. If this function returns true, the tool is accepting the mouse event, and will continue to receive mouse events through the mouseMove() and mouseRelease() methods.

Reimplemented in DzMaterialPickTool, DzPickTool, DzRotateTool, and DzTransformTool.

void DzViewTool::mouseRelease ( Dz3DViewport *  view,
QMouseEvent *  e,
DzViewportMgr::ViewMouseModifier  accel 
) [inline, virtual]

Called when the user releases the mouse, ending a drag operation. The x and y values are the location of the mouse relative to the upper left corner of the viewport. If commit is false, any changes that the tool made should be undone before returning.

Reimplemented in DzRotateTool, and DzTransformTool.

QString DzViewTool::whatsThisText (  )  const [inline, virtual]

Derived classes should return any text that should be displayed as the "What's This?" text for the tool.

Reimplemented in DzMaterialPickTool, DzRotateTool, DzScaleTool, and DzTranslateTool.
